verb.description: Drive with (a car engine) at or above its rated maximum rpm.
examples: both his engines were redlined now

verb.description: Refuse (a loan or insurance) to someone because they live in an area deemed to be a poor financial risk.

noun.description: The maximum number of revolutions per minute for a car engine.

origin: From the use of red as a limit marker, in redline (sense 2 of the verb) a limit marked out by ringing a section of a map.
